element.definition: This resource provides the adjudication details from the processing of a Claim resource.

element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.

element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

The sequence number of the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is elsewhere.
The sequence number of the addition within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is not related to an Addition.
The sequence number of the addition within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is not related to an Addition.

binding.description: The error codes for adjudication processing.

element.definition: An error code,froma specified code system, which details why the claim could not be adjudicated.

element.short: Total Cost of service from the Claim
element.requirements: This is a check value that the receiver calculates and returns.
element.definition: The total cost of the services reported.
The amount of deductible applied which was not allocated to any particular service line.

element.short: Total benefit payable for the Claim
element.definition: Total amount of benefit payable (Equal to sum of the Benefit amounts from all detail lines and additions less the Unallocated Deductible).
Adjustment to the payment of this transaction which is not related to adjudication of this transaction.
Reason for the payment adjustment.
Estimated payment data.
Payable less any payment adjustment.
Payment identifier.

The sequence number of the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is elsewhere.
The sequence number of the addition within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is not related to an Addition.
The sequence number of the addition within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error is not related to an Addition.

binding.description: The error codes for adjudication processing.

element.definition: An error code,froma specified code system, which details why the claim could not be adjudicated.

element.short: Total Cost of service from the Claim
element.requirements: This is a check value that the receiver calculates and returns.
element.definition: The total cost of the services reported.
The amount of deductible applied which was not allocated to any particular service line.

element.short: Total benefit payable for the Claim
element.definition: Total amount of benefit payable (Equal to sum of the Benefit amounts from all detail lines and additions less the Unallocated Deductible).
Adjustment to the payment of this transaction which is not related to adjudication of this transaction.
Reason for the payment adjustment.
Estimated payment data.
Payable less any payment adjustment.
Payment identifier.

binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.definition: Status of funds reservation (For provider, for Patient, None).
The form to be used for printing the content.
Note text.
An integer associated with each note which may be referred to from each service line item.
The note purpose: Print/Display.
The note text.

element.requirements: Health care programs and insurers are significant payors of health service costs.
element.definition: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

element.requirements: To maintain order of the coverages.
element.definition: A service line item.

element.requirements: To identify which coverage is being adjudicated.
element.definition: The instance number of the Coverage which is the focus for adjudication. The Coverage against which the claim is to be adjudicated.

element.requirements: Need to identify the issuer to target for processing and for coordination of benefit processing.
element.definition: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.
The contract number of a business agreement which describes the terms and conditions.

binding.description: The code for the relationship of the patient to the subscriber.

element.requirements: To determine the relationship between the patient and the subscriber.
element.definition: The relationship of the patient to the subscriber.

element.requirements: To provide any pre-determination or prior authorization reference.
element.definition: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.

element.requirements: Used by downstream payers to determine what balance remains and the net payable.
element.definition: The Coverages adjudication details.

binding.description: The static and dynamic model to which contents conform, which may be business version or standard/version.

element.requirements: Knowledge of the original version can inform the processing of this instance so that information which is processable by the originating system may be generated.
element.definition: The style (standard) and version of the original material which was converted into this resource.
